text: A part of all I earn is mine to keep.
author: George S. Clason

text: Make thy gold multiply.
author: George S. Clason

text: Control thy expenditures.
author: George S. Clason

text: Increase thy ability to earn.
author: George S. Clason

text: Do not save what is left after spending; spend what is left after saving.
author: Anonymous

text: Every dollar is an employee—give it a job.
author: Anonymous

text: Small leaks sink big ships; track the drips.
author: Anonymous

text: Invest in what you understand and can explain simply.
author: Anonymous

text: Wealth grows quietly, expense shouts loudly.
author: Anonymous

text: Let compounding be your loudest flex.
author: Anonymous

text: Budget is a compass, not a cage.
author: Anonymous

text: Build margins before monuments.
author: Anonymous

text: Pay future‑you first.
author: Anonymous

text: If you can’t explain it, don’t buy it.
author: Anonymous

text: Cut the recurring, fund the rewarding.
author: Anonymous

text: A quiet plan beats a loud purchase.
author: Anonymous

text: Save automatically so you don’t negotiate monthly.
author: Anonymous

text: Make room for emergencies while life is calm.
author: Anonymous

text: Protect downside, let upside take care of itself.
author: Anonymous

text: Wealth is time you own.
author: Anonymous
